You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question.- You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 220, 649]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|> INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 732, 905, 860]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[269, 867, 728, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 16 pages. Any blank pages are indicated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 739, 89]]<|/det|>
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 616, 120]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the density of a liquid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 146, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 134, 180, 152]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 133, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with a U-tube containing coloured water. The U-tube has two sides, \(\mathbf{A}\) and \(\mathbf{B}\), as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 180, 823, 198]]<|/det|>
The wooden strip is supported by a stand and clamp (not shown in Fig. 1.1).

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[183, 207, 813, 532]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 543, 532, 561]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 72, 210, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 71, 609, 88]]<|/det|>
You are provided with a beaker containing oil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
Use the pipette to slowly put oil into \(\mathbf{A}\). Wait to allow the oil to reach the water surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 133, 920, 166]]<|/det|>
The final length of the oil column above the water in \(\mathbf{A}\) is \(F\). Continue adding oil until \(F\) is approximately \(7 \text{cm}\), as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 175, 764, 492]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 504, 534, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 536, 220, 552]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 536, 425, 552]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(F\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 580, 920, 598]]<|/det|>
<form>F = .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 581, 920, 598]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 73, 180, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Use the pipette to slowly put oil into \(\mathbf{B}\). Wait to allow the oil to reach the water surface.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 103, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
The final length of the oil column above the water in \(\mathbf{B}\) is \(h\). Continue adding oil until \(h\) is approximately \(3\mathrm{cm}\), as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 147, 767, 472]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 482, 534, 501]]<|/det|>
<mark>[fig. 1.3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 514, 220, 530]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 514, 423, 530]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(h\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 559, 920, 577]]<|/det|>
<form>\(h =\) .................................................... $cm$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 591, 212, 609]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 591, 920, 625]]<|/det|>
The height of the water level in \(\mathbf{A}\) is \(a\), and the height of the water level in \(\mathbf{B}\) is \(b\), as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 638, 473, 656]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 653, 918, 672]]<|/det|>
<form>a = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 700, 918, 718]]<|/det|>
<form>b = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 730, 220, 749]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 730, 378, 749]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(y\) using

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[460, 745, 539, 764]]<|/det|>
\[y = b - a\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 823, 920, 841]]<|/det|>
<form>y = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 839, 920, 857]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Repeat (a)(ii) with increasing amounts of oil in \(\mathbf{B}\) until you have six sets of values of \(h\), \(a\), \(b\) and \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 761, 135]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Some of your values of \(y\) may be negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 521, 920, 539]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 722, 91]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that the quantities \(y\) and \(h\) are related by the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[448, 102, 549, 121]]<|/det|>
\[y = P h + Q\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 405, 152]]<|/det|>
where \(P\) and \(Q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 680, 183]]<|/det|>
Use your answers in **(c)**(iii) to determine the values of \(P\) and \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 346, 198]]<|/det|>
Give appropriate units.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 318, 917, 337]]<|/det|>
<form>P = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 350, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
<form>Q = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 367, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 396, 144, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 603, 415]]<|/det|>
Calculate the density \(\rho\) of the oil using the relationship

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[458, 427, 541, 445]]<|/det|>
\[QR = F\rho\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 457, 517, 476]]<|/det|>
where \(R\) is a constant with value \(1.0 \text{g} \text{cm}^{-3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 488, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
Include an appropriate unit and give your answer to an appropriate number of significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 644, 920, 663]]<|/det|>
<form>ρ = ........................................................ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 675, 920, 693]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 20]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 737, 89]]<|/det|>
You may not need to use all of the materials provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 99, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 101, 720, 120]]<|/det|>

<label>(a)</label>

Adjust the apparatus so that the rods of the clamps are approximately \(55 \text{cm}\) apart, as shown.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 587, 220, 605]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 587, 539, 605]]<|/det|>
Roll the modelling clay into a sphere.

<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 725, 645, 744]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 920, 135]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 396, 920, 415]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 427, 181, 445]]<|/det|>
